name: Da Vinci's Brush
description:
Creamy marshmallow goodness. It's as simple as that. I wanted a marshmallow vape. I was watching Pineapple Express. Davinci's Brush was born. I honestly don't have any notes for this recipe. It was thrown together pretty quickly, but turned out wonderfully. I'll try and go through my thought process, though.

"TFA Marshmallow and FA Marshmallow taste yummy. They're both marshmallows. Fucking Franco. I bet they'll taste like hot air if I don't do something, though. Graham Cracker. That shit's tasty. Just enough to sit under the 'mellows. VBIC. Tasty. It's white, too. Throw that in there. Add some volume to the 'mellows. Bavarian Cream? I guess. Turn it into some kinda cool creamy marshmallow thing? Huh. Okay, then. You are crazy with them names, Ted. You are. "
author: SleepersDemon

reviews.text: This is really delicious. Smooth, balanced, perfect. My search for a great marshmallow mix is over. Thanks for sharing this recipe.

This is an adv right here. I was combing through recipes trying to find something that would work on the fly as I spilled the last of my PRY4. I thought this one looked good and I was in a hurry so I went for it. It's fluffy, sweet and very satisfying. The graham is very subtle and does a great job at adding just a little texture to round everything out. The balance of the marshmallows and cream really play well off each other.  While it didn't work necessarily as a shake n vape due to the off-notes in tpa marshmallow, it doesn't take very long for this one to bloom. I think the 2 day steep time is perfect for this one. I'm thinking of adding some butterscotch to this one and seeing how that goes. Great job

I love this. Been trying to create a marshmallow vape for months on end, to no avail. This completely hits the spot for me. The Graham Cracker is a nice touch. Makes the whole thing way more interesting, without getting in the way of the primary fluffy marshmallow notes. Seriously impressive work. Thanks for sharing!
I had the pleasure of previewing this one before it was published and it was delicious. It's like biting into a big fluffy homemade marshmallow with a very light coating of graham cracker dust.
